result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse County case 15CF571, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Comply with any programming deemed appropriate by the PO - PO is advised to use trauma programming as well as AODA programming

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DoC Supervision fees

Credit for 71 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

superMiscConds.notes:
Make payments toward any outstanding financial obligations.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
